task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 67°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
I still can't see the top of the building, so I need to look up further to see the roofline.
I still cannot see the top of the building, so I will continue to tilt my view upwards to find the roofline.
I still can't see the top of the building, so I need to look up even further to find the roofline.
My attempts to look further up are not working as the pitch remains at 30 degrees; therefore, I will move backward to get a wider field of view that might include the building's roof.
I have moved backward, but now I'm facing away from the building; I need to turn around to face it again to continue my assessment.
Now that I've moved back and am facing the building again, I need to look up to see the full height and find the roofline.

Now that I have moved back, I can see the entire building from the ground to the roof; I can count approximately 13 floors, and assuming a standard floor height of about 3 meters, plus a bit for the ground floor and roof structure, I estimate the total height to be around 42 meters.
